title: [docs] CLI init command does not accept devUrl null

labels.name: type: documentation
labels.description: Need to update the API documentation

body:
Documentation states the `devUrl` can be `null`, although Tauri CLI does not allow setting none.

> [devUrl](https://beta.tauri.app/references/v2/config/#devurl)
> string | null formatted as uri
> 
> The URL to load in development.
> 
> This is usually an URL to a dev server, which serves your application assets with hot-reload and HMR. Most modern JavaScript bundlers like [vite](https://vitejs.dev/guide/) provides a way to start a dev server by default.
> 
> If you don’t have a dev server or don’t want to use one, ignore this option and use [frontendDist](buildconfig::frontend_dist) and point to a web assets directory, and Tauri CLI will run its built-in dev server and provide a simple hot-reload experience.

Undefined `--dev-url` is recognized as none, but not applied as such:

```console
% cargo tauri init --dev-url -D ../src -A tst --before-dev-command "" --before-build-command "" -W Test  
error: a value is required for '--dev-url <DEV_URL>' but none was supplied

For more information, try '--help'.
```

Init without `--dev-url` prompts for the dev server URL:

```console
% cargo tauri init -D ../src -A tst --before-dev-command "" --before-build-command "" -W Test  
? What is the url of your dev server? › 
```

Therefore it is not possible to provision a repository without any dev server.

```console
% cargo tauri --version
tauri-cli 2.0.0-beta.9
```
